disease: Basal cell carcinoma of skin of other part of trunk

symptoms.name: Bullous lesion
symptoms.severity: Slowly increasing in size over five years
symptoms.pattern: Well-defined, erythematous, measuring 2.5x1.5 cm on the right lumbar region

physical_findings: Well-defined erythematous bullous lesion measuring 2.5x1.5 cm on trunk, over the right lumbar region
No lesions elsewhere on the body
risk_factors: Naevoid basal cell carcinoma syndrome (Gorlin's syndrome)

required: Histopathological examination showing thin anastomosing epithelial cords of atypical basaloid cells surrounded by fibromyxoid stroma with cyst formation filled with mucin
supportive: Clinical presentation of a slowly growing bullous lesion
